whack.translation[0].definitions[0].defi: to hit someone or something hard
whack.translation[0].definitions[0].exam: He kept whacking the dog with a stick.
whack.translation[0].definitions[1].exam: Just whack the bacon under the grill for a couple of minutes.
whack.translation[1].definitions[0].defi: the act of hitting something hard, or the noise this makes
whack.translation[1].definitions[0].exam: She gave the ball a whack.
Singleton took a whack at (=tried to hit) Miller’s head.
whack.translation[1].definitions[1].exam: There’s still a fair whack (=quite a large amount) of work to be done.
These agencies charge top whack for tickets.
If you’re unemployed, you don’t have to pay the full whack (=the full amount).
